column4: anyone here have some experience with running parallels ? (XP as guest OS) running under Ubuntu (Host)
Parallels is horrible, trying to get wireless working on it
you might want to look for a parallel channel,  it's the newest player
I'm not sure I get the problem , is your sound currently working or not ?
nope not working, i get this error message: No volume control GStreamer plugins and/or devices found.
open a terminal and type alsamixer
I get this error: alsamixer: function snd_ctl_open failed for default: No such file or directory
got this error when i typed that in: E: Couldn't find package alsamixer
sudo apt-get install alsa-utils alsa-tools alsa-tools-gui
kk done, it added a lot of crap under Sound
try typing alsamixer in the terminal again
same error :( alsamixer: function snd_ctl_open failed for default: No such file or directory
ahorriblemess   type lspci in the terminal , see if your can tell if your sound card is listed
Audio device: Intel Corporation 82801H (ICH8 Family) HD Audio Controller (rev 02)
ok , your card is listed, righr click the volume icon in the top pannel , select properties, or prefernces, see if you can select another device
